decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and board wipes such as Terminus. The deck aims to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Portent and Predict while generating card advantage with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Snapcaster Mage. Monastery Mentor provides a win condition by creating tokens, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers card selection and additional control options. The deck prioritizes efficient removal and permission spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy. It also includes powerful removal like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the board early on using cheap spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to flip Delver quickly, while also generating value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Deathrite Shaman. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler along with disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes powerful removal options like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command, as well as card advantage engines like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe. Additionally, the deck runs a mana denial strategy with Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases and control the tempo of the game.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to establish and maintain control over the game through disruption and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage and selection to ensure consistency and efficiency. By running a mix of counter spells like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Supreme Will, along with removal like Swords to Plowshares and board wipes like Terminus, the deck is able to answer threats and control the board. Additionally, card selection from cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with card advantage from Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage, allows the deck to stay ahead in resources and outvalue the opponent. The deck also runs powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to provide additional win conditions and value.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard to generate value and control the battlefield. It uses Life from the Loam to recur lands and fuel Knight of the Reliquary, while also using Punishing Fire and Grove of the Burnwillows to control the opponent's creatures. Liliana of the Veil provides disruption and removal, while Chalice of the Void and Mox Diamond help with mana acceleration and disruption. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through grinding out resources and controlling the game through attrition.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible by utilizing powerful mana acceleration and disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void. It aims to overwhelm opponents with fast threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, while also providing some flexibility with cards like Warping Wail and Dismember for removal and disruption. The combination of efficient Eldrazi creatures and disruptive elements allows the deck to apply constant pressure on the opponent and potentially disrupt their game plan, leading to a faster victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play early in the game. It also includes card draw and counter spells to protect the combo and control the game. The goal is to quickly put a big threat onto the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The deck aims to win efficiently and decisively through its powerful combo pieces.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Grim Lavamancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer while disrupting opponent's game plan with cards like Gitaxian Probe, Ponder, Brainstorm, Daze, Force of Will, Lightning Bolt, and Stifle. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, utilizing fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Scalding Tarn to find dual lands like Volcanic Island. Wasteland is included to disrupt opponent's mana base. The key strategy is to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with counter spells and land destruction. By utilizing cards like Wasteland and Stifle to slow down the opponent's mana development, while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis, this deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Brainstorm and Ponder helps to ensure consistency and card selection, making this Grixis Aggro deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful ramp engine using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost to generate massive amounts of mana. This mana is then used to cast big Eldrazi threats such as Ulamog, Kozilek, and Emrakul. The deck also includes disruption elements like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to control the pace of the game. Additionally, it includes utility cards like Voltaic Key and Thran Dynamo to further accelerate the mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its massive threats and resource advantage.

The deck heavily focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. It also utilizes the synergy between Life from the Loam and Knight of the Reliquary to create a steady stream of land drops and threats. Chalice of the Void helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Punishing Fire provides removal and recurring damage. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil adds another layer of control to the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to gain an advantage.

The deck focuses on cheating big, game-winning creatures into play early using the "Show and Tell" and "Sneak Attack" cards. By using powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo, the deck aims to quickly drop game-ending threats like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also runs efficient card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up the combo and ensure consistency. With access to mana acceleration and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast and powerful plays.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The deck also has efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt, as well as disruption with Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman. By applying pressure early and backing it up with countermagic and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly while disrupting the opponent's plans with hand disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure card advantage and smooth out draws. Lightning Bolt provides versatile removal while cards like Deathrite Shaman and Gitaxian Probe allow for additional synergy and flexibility. The mana base is finely tuned to support the deck's three-color requirements, with lands like Wasteland offering additional disruption options. The deck aims to pressure and control the opponent simultaneously to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through efficient removal and counterspells, while using card draw and manipulation to set up powerful plays with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. Cards like Counterbalance and Search for Azcanta provide additional ways to control the flow of the game, while Terminus acts as a powerful board wipe. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue opponents through card advantage and strategic gameplay.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while quickly putting pressure on them with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to control the game with disruption spells like Daze and remove any threats with Lightning Bolt and Gurmag Angler. The mana base is tuned for consistency and disruption, with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and enable quick wins. Overall, this deck is a fast-paced aggressive strategy that aims to control the game while dealing damage quickly.
